Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Outcome: Judicial review allowed, decision set aside, case remitted for rehearing
Legal_Framework: International refugee law, domestic immigration law
Evidence_Requirement: Clear and convincing evidence to rebut presumption of state protection
Evidence_Type: Incident reports, police response records, personal testimony, documentation of attacks
Jurisdiction: Canada (federal court review of refugee claim)
Assessment_Standard: State protection availability, risk of persecution
Governing_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Complaint_Issues: Police disinterest, failure to investigate attacks, ongoing hostility due to sexual orientation
State_Protection_Assessment: Presumption of state protection rebutted by evidence of lack of police action and repeated attacks
Risk_Factor: Targeted violence due to sexual orientation
Credibility: Evidence provided was credible and corroborated
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
State_Protection_Adequacy: Found inadequate due to official indifference and failure to protect
Risk_Nature: Non-state actor violence with state complicity or neglect
Enforcement_Action: Lack of police investigation or protective measures
